See also: Dauern

German[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈdaʊ̯ɐn/

Etymology 1[edit]

From Middle High German dūren, borrowed from Middle Low German dūren, itself from Latin durāre, infinitive of durō. Compare Dutch duren.

Verb[edit]

dauern (third-person singular simple present dauert, past tense dauerte, past participle gedauert, auxiliary haben)

  1. to last, to continue over time
  2. to persist
  3. to take (time)
Derived terms[edit]
  • ausdauern
  • Dauer
  • dauerhaft
  • andauern

Etymology 2[edit]

See bedauern.

Verb[edit]

dauern (third-person singular simple present dauert, past tense dauerte, past participle gedauert, auxiliary haben)

  1. (archaic, with accusative) to grieve; to arouse pity

Synonyms[edit]

  • leidtun
  • schmerzen

Derived terms[edit]

  • bedauern
